titles.title: Federal Maritime Commission Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1995
Federal Maritime Commission Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1995
To authorize appropriations for the Federal Maritime Commission for fiscal year 1995.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee On Merchant Marine.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Executive Comment Requested from Fed Maritime Comm.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Favorable Executive Comment Received from Fed Maritime Comm.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept. 103-716.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 393.

action.text: Mr. Studds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

bill.summary: 9/12/1994--Passed House amended. Federal Maritime Commission Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1995 - Authorizes appropriations for the Federal Maritime Commission for FY 1995. Amends the Shipping Act of 1984 to require each conference agreement to provide that: (1) any member of the conference may take independent action on any level of ocean freight forwarder compensation required to be filed in a tariff upon not more than ten calendar days notice; and (2) the conference will include the level of ocean freight forwarder compensation in its tariff for use by that member, effective no later than ten calendar days after receipt of the notice, and by any other member that notifies the conference that it elects to adopt such level of compensation on or after its effective date. Prohibits any conference or group of two or more common carriers from limiting the compensation of an ocean freight forwarder in the export foreign commerce of the United States to less than 1.25 percent of the aggregate of all of the rates and charges applicable under the tariff assessed against the cargo on which the forwarding services are provided.
